sub_title: Senior Athletics Manager at Team Liquid
summary: I have an MA in Philosophy from the University of Toronto, and am now working in the Athetics Department at Team Liquid. I love working with people and with information, and I am always willing to learn something new!

awards.title: Conference Participant
awards.description:
Chosen to present at the 4th Annual COVE Conference at Carleton University. 
Paper: Reconciling the Doctrine of Double Effect and Virtue Ethics
awards.issuer: Carleton University Centre on Values and Ethics

awards.title: Conference Participant
awards.description:
Chosen to present 2 papers at the Hawaii Conference:
1) John Stuart Mill’s Theory of Education and Virtue Cultivation
2) Cyborg Epistemologies: Theories of Knowledge in Cyborg Literature
awards.issuer: Annual Hawaii International Conference on Arts & Humanities

awards.title: Hume Wrong Scholarship
awards.description: Recipient of a scholarship that is "awarded annually to the leading student in the Third year of History or Political Science proceeding to his or her final Honours year".

awards.title: Senate Medal for Outstanding Academic Achievement
awards.description: Awarded a Senate Medal upon graduation for being in the top 3% of the graduating class (with an overall GPA of at least 10.60), and for maintaining an overall CGPA of at least 11.00 on a 12.00 scale.

awards.title: Conference Participant
awards.description:
Chosen to present at the Annual Ohio State University Undergraduate Philosophy Conference. 
Paper: John Stuart Mill’s Theory of Education and Virtue Cultivation

awards.title: Ontario Graduate Scholarship
awards.description: Recipient of an OGS award for graduate school. Awarded to students who a) have a research proposal that is approved and selected by a panel of experts in the field, and b) who have at least an A- average at the time of application.
awards.issuer: Ministry of Training, Colleges, and Universities

awards.title: Entrance Scholarship
awards.description: Awarded an Entrance scholarship for entering my undergraduate with a high school average of %94; was able to renew this scholarship each year of my undergraduate because I maintained an A- average (total of $15, 000 CDN over four years)

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.description: Made it onto the Dean's List at Carleton University for all years of study (2007-2011)

projects.title: Riot NACC CSL Qualifiers
projects.description: Worked with Riot Games, IvyLoL, and the NACL in order to provide college students the opportunity to compete for $100,000 in scholarships. As General Manager for CSL League of Legends, I met regularly with CSL staff to discuss details and assign tasks. I helped seed the teams and generate the brackets, helped production organize and mod the twitch.tv/collegiatelol stream (had over 290,000 unique viewers over two weekends), helped the content department connect with players for interviews, and even conducted an interview during the finals weekend at LCS studios (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mC0QPauivec)!

contributors.headline: Senior Athletics Manager at Team Liquid

profile_positions.description:
- Operations day-to-day with all of our European athletics rosters
- Responsible for the performance and health of all European players/managers/coaches
- Scout, sign, and on-board new players in Europe; develop contracts, terms, and deliverables for existing and incoming Athletes/Coaches/Managers
- Manage Brand Compliance for Athletes and influencers
- Act as a liaison between Team Liquid and any developers or tournament organizers; work alongside these parties to develop leagues, franchising, and so on
- Work alongside our BMC team on creative projects, marketing, and public announcements
- Develop and execute on long term athlete initiatives and strategy
profile_positions.title: Senior Athletics Manager, EU

profile_positions.description:
- Managed 22 players across 7 games (FIFA, Heroes of the Storm, PLAYERUNKNOWN's Battlegrounds, Street Fighter, StarCraft 2, Super Smash Bros. Melee, Super Smash Bros. Wii U)
- Supervised 4 player managers (Fortnite, Rainbow 6, Smash, Hearthstone)
- Was responsible for calendar management, sponsorship deliverables, managing player gear requests, and collecting player invoices
- Worked with players to enter tournaments, and to schedule community interaction and interviews
- Met weekly with the Head of esports to plan out the week’s tasks and reported player’s deliverable work
- Listened to any complaints, worked with players to find solutions; acted as a liaison between the organization and the players
- Managed the player boot camp house, booked travel for the players
- Managed and conducted the player and staff training
- Attended live events to assist players; acted as a point of contact for Tournament Organizers; handled the logistics for interview, media, and fan meet requests at live events
- Assisted with sponsor reports, research projects, and other projects
- Sponsor account management
- Head of Team Liquid's Discord Community Initiative
- Scouted and researched potential players and new games; recruited and contracted new players
profile_positions.title: Senior Player Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Managed Social Media promotions for the CSL
- Worked with CEO and Directors to coordinate CSL operations
- Acted as a liaison between participants and the organization
- Conducted weekly meetings with and assigned tasks to 5 Community Managers
- Ensured that our social media platforms were updated, and that all posts reflected the CSL's vision
- Coordinated promotions for content, broadcasts, announcements, giveaways, and contests
- Designed and executed contests; interacted with the community through streams, emails, events, contests, etc.
profile_positions.title: Community Director

profile_positions.description:
- helped organize events and tournaments for collegiate League of Legends players; answered their questions, and helped make sure they were ready to play their matches
- managed and assigned tasks to volunteers
- looked at applications and interviewed potential volunteer candidates
- lead department meetings; attended general and admin meetings
- prepared and reviewed sponsor proposals
- helped departments with any tasks and ensured that they had what they needed
- connected with members of our community!
profile_positions.title: General Manager, League of Legends Division (Volunteer)

volunteer_experiences.description:
- Worked with a large group of dedicated and passionate volunteers to organize a collegiate eSports tournament, with over 750 registered colleges and universities in North America (across 4 games)
- Answered emails from participants and sponsors; ensured that emails get forwarded to the appropriate admins
- Composed Google docs and Excel spreadsheets; entered data on and maintained spreadsheets; enter data on company website
- Created agendas, took attendance and minutes, and lead staff meetings
- Ensured that staff was updated on meeting schedules, as well as other general notices
- Assigned staff weekly tasks, and coordinated with departments to organize larger events
- Received and provided feedback on company's performance, as well as personal performance
- Ensured that staff was informed of our projects and were well supported; helped staff brainstorm new projects and ways to complete them
- Acted as a contact point for all CSL: LoL staff and participants
